ABB  - Head of Government Relations and Public Affairs for the European Union  
 May 2020 – Current (Brussels, BE)  
• Built ABB’s EU representation office  from the ground up  following the 2020 corporate restructurin g.  
• Defin ing the pu blic affairs strategy and budget for Europe  (and KPIs)  in line with relevant business objectives . 
• Leading on the adaptation of ABB’s group narrative and strategic priorities for EU audiences in Brussels and key capitals e.g. 
on green electrification,  hydrogen,  AI, energy efficiency,  sustainable mobility and industrial decarbonisation . 
• Positioning ABB as a thought leader & trus ted advisor in EU policy circles by providing timely and relevant input to decision -
makers and shaping the discussion amongst policy ‘influencers’ (NGOs, think tanks, academia).  
• Securing timely and relevant EU insights and intelligence to ABB’s senior lea ders across businesses and support functions 
to support their strategic decision making (e.g. on political/regula tory risk and EU sanctions ).   
• Facilitating interaction between ABB business leaders and EU  and member States’ decision makers.  
• Supporting business e xecutives, including the CEO, in high -level  organisations such as the European Roundtable of Industry 
(ERT) , the European Clean Hydrogen Alliance (ECH2A) and the “CEO Alliance  for Europe’s Recovery, Reform and Resilience” 
(chair of the policy task force).  
• Represent ing ABB in industry associations  (Orgalim, European Clean Hydrogen A lliance, Wind Europe, ChargeUp Europe, 
CEMEP, T&D Europe).  
• Chair of the Sustainable Transport Task Force at Orgalim – Europe’s Technology Industry Association -. 
 
Eni - EU Government Affairs Manager – Climate, Energy Policy and Sustainable Finance  Lead  
June 2015 to April 2020  (Brussels, BE)

and under budget through efficient stakeholder coordination and a successful outreach strategy across Europe.  
• Represent ed Eni in multiple international  trade associations . EU Sherpa for the CEO in the European Roundtable of 
Industrialists (ERT).
